text: üé∏ HarmoniX Academy Master the Neck, Master the Music A next-generation, interactive guitar learning platform built for musicians, educators, and students to visualize, hear, and master music theory directly on a virtual fretboard. Combines scales, modes, the CAGED system, audio playback, AI-guided prompts, and real-time pitch detection ‚Äî all wrapped in a beautiful glassy UI. üöÄ Overview HarmoniX Academy transforms traditional guitar learning into a digital experience. Explore scales, visualize intervals, train your ear, and interact with theory like never before. Key highlights: üéµ Interactive Fretboard ‚Äî 6 strings √ó 24 frets with real-time note highlighting üîä Scale Player ‚Äî Hear scales ascending/descending using Tone.js üß† Theory Assistant ‚Äî Explore formulas, chord relationships, and intervals üé∏ CAGED System Visualization ‚Äî See all 5 movable patterns dynamically ü™ó AI Tutor Mode ‚Äî Follow guided prompts and challenges to learn theory interactively üéöÔ∏è Metronome + Tuner ‚Äî Practice in rhythm and tune your guitar live üìà Progress Tracking ‚Äî XP, streaks, and lessons saved via backend üíé Glassy Modern UI ‚Äî Smooth transitions, color-coded degrees, and vibrant themes üß© Tech Stack Layer Technologies üé® Frontend React.js, React Router, Tone.js, Tonal.js, TailwindCSS / Custom CSS, Framer Motion ‚öôÔ∏è Backend Node.js, Express.js, MongoDB, Mongoose üîä Audio & Theory Web Audio API, Tone.js, @tonaljs/tonal üîê Auth & Data JWT, bcrypt, MongoDB Atlas üß† AI Prompt Engine Custom logic engine for guided lessons üß≠ State Management React Context / Hooks üì¶ Deployment Vercel (Frontend), Render / Railway (Backend) üóÇÔ∏è Folder Structure src/ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ App.js ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ App.css ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ features/ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ auth/ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ page/ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ LoginPage.jsx ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ SignupPage.jsx ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ dashboard/ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ page/ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ DashboardPage.jsx ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ fretboard/ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ component/ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Fretboard.jsx ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ TheorySidebar.jsx ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ ScalePlayer.jsx ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ useScalePlayer.js ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ useCagedShapes.js ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ usePrompts.js ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ data/ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ scaleData.js ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ cagedData.js ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ intervalInfo.js ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ tuner/ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ page/ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ TunerPage.jsx ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ hooks/ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ useTuner.js ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ css/ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ tuner.css ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ metronome/ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ component/ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Metronome.jsx ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ css/ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ metronome.css ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ ai-tutor/ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ component/ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ PromptEngine.jsx ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ LessonCard.jsx ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ data/ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ promptData.js ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ css/ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ tutor.css ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ backend/ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ server.js ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ routes/ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ models/ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ controllers/ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ config/ üíª Setup & Installation üß± Prerequisites Make sure you have: Node.js ‚â• 18 MongoDB Atlas / local instance npm / yarn ‚öôÔ∏è Clone and Install git clone https://github.com/yourusername/harmonix-academy.git cd harmonix-academy npm install cd backend && npm install üîß Environment Variables Create .env in /backend: MONGODB_URI=your_mongo_connection_string JWT_SECRET=your_secret PORT=5000 üöÄ Run the app # Start backend cd backend npm run dev # Start frontend cd .. npm start App runs at üëâ http://localhost:3000 üé∂ Core Features Breakdown üé∏ Fretboard Select root & scale Dynamic degree highlighting Click ‚Üí Hear note (Tone.js) Hover ‚Üí Interval tooltip Positions 1‚Äì5 toggle Optional CAGED overlays üß† Theory Sidebar Displays scale info, intervals, and chord relations Explains mood of each mode Offers quick access to related scales üîä Scale Player Sequential playback (ascending/descending) Adjustable tempo (BPM) Loop playback option üéì AI Tutor Mode Gamified learning system Challenges like ‚ÄúFind all G notes‚Äù or ‚ÄúIdentify the 5th degree‚Äù Awards XP & lesson completion üéß Tuner Uses getUserMedia for live input Shows note name, frequency, and pitch deviation üïí Metronome Tap tempo or manual BPM Visual + sound click Customizable accent beat ü™∂ CAGED Mode Overlay all 5 major/minor shapes Visual guide for pattern memorization Each position linked to practice exercises üåà UI Design Modern glassy UI Adaptive to light/dark theme (Amp Mode) Fretboard with vivid color-coded scale degrees Smooth transitions using Framer Motion üß© Future Roadmap ‚úÖ v1 ‚Äì Fretboard, Scales, Theory, Tuner

üéß Tuner Uses getUserMedia for live input Shows note name, frequency, and pitch deviation üïí Metronome Tap tempo or manual BPM Visual + sound click Customizable accent beat ü™∂ CAGED Mode Overlay all 5 major/minor shapes Visual guide for pattern memorization Each position linked to practice exercises üåà UI Design Modern glassy UI Adaptive to light/dark theme (Amp Mode) Fretboard with vivid color-coded scale degrees Smooth transitions using Framer Motion üß© Future Roadmap ‚úÖ v1 ‚Äì Fretboard, Scales, Theory, Tuner üîÑ v2 ‚Äì Lesson Engine + User Profiles üéß v3 ‚Äì Ear Training Mode + Sound Recognition üé∏ v4 ‚Äì Backing Track Player üß† v5 ‚Äì AI-powered practice coach üì± v6 ‚Äì Mobile PWA version üßë‚Äçüéì Target Users Beginner guitarists learning scales Intermediate players mastering the neck Music teachers who want visual tools Advanced users exploring modes & improvisation üè∑Ô∏è Brand Identity App Name: HarmoniX Academy Tagline: ‚ÄúMaster the neck, master the music.‚Äù Theme: Neo-Glassy Tech / Modern Learning Studio Accent Colors: Orange (#f97316) & Indigo (#4f46e5) ü§ù Contributing Pull requests are welcome! If you‚Äôd like to contribute lessons or improve the theory engine: Fork the repo Create your branch (feature/new-lesson) Commit changes Open a PR üé∏ üìú License MIT License ¬© 2025 ‚Äî Built for musicians by musicians üé∂ ‚ö° Acknowledgments Tonal.js for scale & interval magic Tone.js for sound synthesis React for the modular architecture You ‚Äî the learner, dreamer, and guitarist üß° üñºÔ∏è Preview (Optional section) (Add screenshots here when ready) üé∏ Dashboard ‚Üí Interactive Fretboard ‚Üí Theory Overlay ‚Üí Scale Player üß© ‚ÄúHarmoniX Academy‚Äù ‚Äî where code meets creativity, music meets interactivity, and you become your own teacher. üé∂

const mongoose = require('mongoose'); module.exports = async function connectDb() { const uri = process.env.MONGODB_URI || 'mongodb://127.0.0.1:27017/harmonix'; mongoose.set('strictQuery', true); await mongoose.connect(uri, { dbName: 'harmonix' }); };

const LessonProgress = require('../models/LessonProgress'); exports.getProgress = async (req, res) => { const userId = req.query.userId; const list = await LessonProgress.find({ userId }); res.json(list); }; exports.updateProgress = async (req, res) => { const { userId, lessonId, status, xpAwarded } = req.body; const doc = await LessonProgress.findOneAndUpdate( { userId, lessonId }, { status, xpAwarded }, { new: true, upsert: true } ); res.json(doc); };

const User = require('../models/User'); exports.register = async (req, res) => { const { email, password } = req.body; if (!email || !password) return res.status(400).json({ message: 'email and password required' }); // demo only: store hash-less (do not use in production) try { const user = await User.create({ email, passwordHash: password }); res.status(201).json({ id: user._id, email: user.email }); } catch (e) { res.status(400).json({ message: e.message }); } }; exports.login = async (req, res) => { const { email, password } = req.body; const user = await User.findOne({ email }); if (!user || user.passwordHash !== password) return res.status(401).json({ message: 'invalid credentials' }); res.json({ id: user._id, email: user.email, xp: user.xp, streak: user.streak }); }; exports.me = async (req, res) => { res.json({ ok: true }); };

const mongoose = require('mongoose'); const lessonProgressSchema = new mongoose.Schema({ userId: { type: mongoose.Schema.Types.ObjectId, ref: 'User', required: true }, lessonId: { type: String, required: true }, status: { type: String, enum: ['not_started','in_progress','completed'], default: 'not_started' }, xpAwarded: { type: Number, default: 0 }, }, { timestamps: true }); module.exports = mongoose.model('LessonProgress', lessonProgressSchema);

const mongoose = require('mongoose'); const userSchema = new mongoose.Schema({ email: { type: String, required: true, unique: true }, passwordHash: { type: String, required: true }, displayName: { type: String }, xp: { type: Number, default: 0 }, streak: { type: Number, default: 0 }, }, { timestamps: true }); module.exports = mongoose.model('User', userSchema);

{ "name": "harmonix-backend", "version": "0.1.0", "private": true, "main": "server.js", "type": "commonjs", "scripts": { "start": "node server.js", "dev": "node server.js" }, "dependencies": { "cors": "^2.8.5", "dotenv": "^16.4.5", "express": "^4.19.2", "mongoose": "^8.7.0" } }
const router = require('express').Router(); const ctrl = require('../controllers/lessonController'); router.get('/', ctrl.getProgress); router.post('/', ctrl.updateProgress); module.exports = router;

const router = require('express').Router(); const ctrl = require('../controllers/userController'); router.post('/register', ctrl.register); router.post('/login', ctrl.login); router.get('/me', ctrl.me); module.exports = router;

const express = require('express'); const cors = require('cors'); const dotenv = require('dotenv'); const connectDb = require('./config/db'); dotenv.config(); const app = express(); app.use(cors()); app.use(express.json()); // routes app.use('/api/users', require('./routes/userRoutes')); app.use('/api/progress', require('./routes/progressRoutes')); app.get('/health', (req, res) => res.json({ ok: true })); const PORT = process.env.PORT || 4000; connectDb().then(() => { app.listen(PORT, () => console.log(`HarmoniX backend running on :${PORT}`)); }).catch(err => { console.error('DB connection failed', err); process.exit(1); });

:root { --neck-bg: #0f172a; } body.light .fb-container { background: #f8fafc; color: #020617; } .fb-note { transition: none; } .fb-note:hover { box-shadow: none; } /* HarmoniX global shell */ .hx-shell { min-height: 100vh; background: radial-gradient(1200px 600px at 20% -10%, rgba(56,189,248,.18), transparent), radial-gradient(1200px 600px at 80% -10%, rgba(99,102,241,.18), transparent), linear-gradient(180deg, #0b1220, #0a0f1c); } .hx-topbar { position: sticky; top: 0; z-index: 50; display: flex; align-items: center; justify-content: space-between; padding: .75rem 1rem; gap: 1rem; background: rgba(2,6,23,.55); border-bottom: 1px solid rgba(148,163,184,.08); backdrop-filter: blur(10px); } .hx-main { padding: 1rem; } .hx-brand { display:flex; align-items:center; gap:.6rem; color:#e2e8f0; } .hx-logo { width:28px; height:28px; border-radius:8px; display:grid; place-items:center; font-weight:800; background: linear-gradient(135deg, #f59e0b, #ea580c); color:#0b1220; } .hx-title .hx-name { font-weight: 700; line-height: 1; } .hx-title .hx-tagline { font-size:.7rem; opacity:.7; line-height:1; } .hx-nav { display:flex; gap:.8rem; } .hx-nav a { color:#cbd5e1; text-decoration:none; font-weight:600; font-size:.95rem; padding:.35rem .55rem; border-radius:.5rem; } .hx-nav a:hover { background: rgba(148,163,184,.15); color:#e2e8f0; } /* Footer */ .hx-footer { margin-top: 2rem; border-top: 1px solid rgba(148,163,184,.1); background: rgba(2,6,23,.55); color: #e2e8f0; } .hx-footer-grid { display: grid; grid-template-columns: 1.5fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; gap: 1.25rem; padding: 1.25rem 1rem; } .hx-footer-brand { display:flex; gap:.7rem; align-items:center; } .hx-foot-head { font-weight:700; margin-bottom:.5rem; } .hx-foot-list { list-style:none; padding:0; margin:0; display:grid; gap:.35rem; } .hx-foot-list a { color:#cbd5e1; text-decoration:none; } .hx-foot-list a:hover { color:#fff; } .hx-foot-bottom { padding: .8rem 1rem; border-top: 1px solid rgba(148,163,184,.08); font-size: .9rem; text-align: center; opacity: .9; } @media (max-width: 900px) { .hx-footer-grid { grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr; } }

import React, { useMemo, useState, useRef } from "react"; import { Scale, Note, Interval, distance, Interval as TonalInterval } from "@tonaljs/tonal"; import "../css/fretboard.css"; import ScalePlayer from "./ScalePlayer"; import CagedOverlay from "./CagedOverlay"; import PromptBanner from "./PromptBanner"; const TUNING = ["E4", "B3", "G3", "D3", "A2", "E2"]; const FRETS = 24; const FRET_MARKERS = { 3: "single", 5: "single", 7: "single", 9: "single", 12: "double", 15: "single", 17: "single", 19: "single", 21: "single", 24: "double", }; // changed: minor -> tonalName: "minor" const SCALE_DATA = { major: { tonalName: "major", label: "Major", formula: ["1", "2", "3", "4", "5", "6", "7"], }, minor: { tonalName: "minor", // ‚¨ÖÔ∏è was "natural minor" label: "Natural Minor", formula: ["1", "2", "b3", "4", "5", "b6", "b7"], }, pentatonic: { tonalName: "minor pentatonic", label: "Pentatonic Minor", formula: ["1", "b3", "4", "5", "b7"], }, blues: { tonalName: "blues", label: "Blues", formula: ["1", "b3", "4", "b5", "5", "b7"], }, dorian: { tonalName: "dorian", label: "Dorian", formula: ["1", "2", "b3", "4", "5", "6", "b7"], }, mixolydian: { tonalName: "mixolydian", label: "Mixolydian", formula: ["1", "2", "3", "4", "5", "6", "b7"], }, }; const DEGREE_COLORS = [ "var(--fb-root)", "var(--fb-degree-2)", "var(--fb-degree-3)", "var(--fb-degree-4)", "var(--fb-degree-5)", "var(--fb-degree-6)", "var(--fb-degree-7)", ]; const ROOTS = ["C", "C#", "D", "D#", "E", "F", "F#", "G", "G#", "A", "A#", "B"]; const POSITIONS = [ { id: "off", label: "No position", range: null }, { id: "p1", label: "Position 1", range: [0, 4] }, { id: "p2", label: "Position 2", range: [3, 7] }, { id: "p3", label: "Position 3", range: [5, 9] }, { id: "p4", label: "Position 4", range: [7, 12] }, { id: "p5", label: "Position 5", range: [12, 17] }, ]; export default function Fretboard() { const [root, setRoot] = useState("C"); const [scaleId, setScaleId] = useState("major"); const [positionId, setPositionId] = useState("off"); const [mode, setMode] = useState("scale"); // "scale" | "caged" | "chord" const [tooltip, setTooltip] = useState(null); const audioCtxRef = useRef(null); const scaleInfo = SCALE_DATA[scaleId]; const scaleNotes = useMemo(() => { const s = Scale.get(`${root} ${scaleInfo.tonalName}`); return s.notes; }, [root, scaleId, scaleInfo]); const degreeMap = useMemo(() => { const map = {}; scaleNotes.forEach((pc, idx) => { map[pc] = idx; }); return map; }, [scaleNotes]); const board = useMemo(() => { return TUNING.map((openNote) => { const stringNotes = []; import React, { useEffect, useRef, useState } from "react"; export default function ScalePlayer({ root, notes, onPlayNote }) { const [bpm, setBpm] = useState(90); const [isLoop, setIsLoop] = useState(false); const [isPlaying, setIsPlaying] = useState(false); const timerRef = useRef(null); const idxRef = useRef(0); useEffect(() => { return () => stop(); // eslint-disable-next-line react-hooks/exhaustive-deps }, []); function step() { const note = notes[idxRef.current % notes.length]; onPlayNote(note + "4"); idxRef.current += 1; if (!isLoop && idxRef.current >= notes.length) { stop(); return; } scheduleNext(); } function scheduleNext() { const intervalMs = (60_000 / bpm); timerRef.current = setTimeout(step, intervalMs); } function playOnce() { if (isPlaying) return; setIsLoop(false); setIsPlaying(true); idxRef.current = 0; scheduleNext(); } function loop() { if (isPlaying) return; setIsLoop(true); setIsPlaying(true); idxRef.current = 0; scheduleNext(); } function stop() { setIsPlaying(false); if (timerRef.current) clearTimeout(timerRef.current); timerRef.current = null; } return (
setBpm(Number(e.target.value))} /> {bpm}
); }

import React from "react"; import intervalInfo from "../data/intervalInfo"; export default function TheorySidebar() { return (

Theory Helper

  • Imaj7

:root { --fb-bg: radial-gradient(circle at top, rgba(15,23,42,.3) 0%, rgba(2,6,23,1) 80%); --fb-border: rgba(148,163,184,.08); --fb-text: #e2e8f0; --fb-muted: #94a3b8; --fb-root: #f97316; --fb-degree-2: #38bdf8; --fb-degree-3: #a855f7; --fb-degree-4: #22c55e; --fb-degree-5: #eab308; --fb-degree-6: #f43f5e; --fb-degree-7: #0ea5e9; } /* container */ .fb-container { background: var(--fb-bg); border: 1px solid var(--fb-border); border-radius: 1rem; padding: 1rem; backdrop-filter: blur(14px); color: var(--fb-text); overflow-x: auto; display: flex; flex-direction: column; gap: 1rem; position: relative; } /* top section */ .fb-top { display: flex; flex-wrap: wrap; justify-content: space-between; gap: 1rem; } .fb-controls { display: flex; flex-wrap: wrap; gap: 1rem; } .fb-control label { display: block; font-size: .6rem; text-transform: uppercase; letter-spacing: .05em; margin-bottom: .25rem; color: var(--fb-muted); } .fb-control select { background: rgba(15,23,42,.25); border: 1px solid rgba(148,163,184,.25); border-radius: .55rem; padding: .25rem .6rem; color: inherit; } /* theory section */ .fb-theory { background: rgba(15,23,42,.2); border: 1px solid rgba(148,163,184,.08); border-radius: .8rem; padding: .6rem .8rem; display: flex; flex-wrap: wrap; gap: 1.25rem; align-items: center; min-height: 70px; } .fb-theory h4 { margin: 0; font-size: .8rem; } .fb-sub { margin: 0; font-size: .62rem; color: var(--fb-muted); } .fb-legend { display: flex; flex-wrap: wrap; gap: .5rem; } .fb-legend-item { display: flex; align-items: center; gap: .25rem; font-size: .6rem; } .fb-legend-dot { width: .75rem; height: .75rem; border-radius: 50%; } .fb-player { display: flex; align-items: center; gap: .75rem; margin-left: auto; } .fb-player-controls { display: flex; gap: .5rem; } .fb-btn { background: rgba(255,255,255,.1); color: #e2e8f0; border: 1px solid rgba(148,163,184,.25); padding: .35rem .6rem; border-radius: .5rem; cursor: pointer; } .fb-btn.ghost { background: transparent; } .fb-btn:disabled { opacity: .6; cursor: not-allowed; } .fb-player-bpm { display: flex; align-items: center; gap: .4rem; font-size: .7rem; color: var(--fb-muted); } /* fret numbers */ .fb-fret-numbers { display: grid; grid-template-columns: 50px repeat(25, 50px); gap: 4px; user-select: none; } .fb-fret-number { text-align: center; font-size: .6rem; color: var(--fb-muted); } /* main board */ .fb-board { display: flex; flex-direction: column; gap: 5px; } /* string rows fixed size */ .fb-string-row { display: grid; grid-template-columns: 50px repeat(25, 50px); gap: 4px; align-items: center; height: 48px; min-height: 48px; max-height: 48px; } .fb-string-label { text-align: center; font-weight: 500; color: var(--fb-muted); line-height: 1; } /* frets locked */ .fb-fret { position: relative; background: linear-gradient(180deg, rgba(15,23,42,.1) 0%, rgba(15,23,42,.45) 100%); border: 1px solid rgba(148,163,184,.05); border-radius: .65rem; box-sizing: border-box; display: flex; justify-content: center; align-items: center; height: 46px; overflow: hidden; } .fb-fret.fb-pos { outline: 1px solid rgba(255,255,255,0.05); background: radial-gradient(circle, rgba(59,130,246,.08) 0%, rgba(15,23,42,0) 70%); } /* note - fixed and isolated layout */ .fb-note { position: relative; width: 38px; height: 34px; box-sizing: border-box; display: flex; justify-content: center; align-items: center; border-radius: .75rem; font-size: .65rem; font-weight: 600; color: #020617; overflow: hidden; cursor: pointer; user-select: none; /* remove aggressive compositing hints to avoid hover jitter */ } .fb-note.in-scale { background: rgba(255,255,255,.9); } .fb-note.is-root { outline: 2px solid rgba(255,255,255,.7); box-shadow: 0 0 8px rgba(249,115,22,.5); } /* fixed degree label */ .fb-note-degree { position: absolute; bottom: 2px; right: 4px; font-size: .5rem; background: rgba(255,255,255,.4); border-radius: 999px; padding: 1px 4px; pointer-events: none; line-height: 1; } .fb-note.is-root .fb-note-degree { background: rgba(2,6,23,.3); color: #fff; font-weight: 700; } /* markers */ .fb-marker { position: absolute; bottom: 4px; width: 9px; height: 9px; background: rgba(148,163,184,.35); border-radius: 50%; } .fb-marker.double { background: transparent; display: flex; gap: 5px; } .fb-marker.double::before, .fb-marker.double::after { content: ""; width: 9px; height: 9px; background: rgba(148,163,184,.35); border-radius: 50%; } /* tooltip - isolated layer */ .fb-tooltip { position: fixed; background: rgba(15,23,42,.95); border: 1px solid rgba(148,163,184,.25); padding: 4px 8px; border-radius: .45rem; font-size: .55rem; z-index: 9999; pointer-events: none; color: #e2e8f0; transform: translateZ(0); } .fb-tooltip-note { font-weight: 600; } .fb-tooltip-sub { color: #94a3b8; } /* AI prompt banner */ .fb-prompt { display:flex; gap:.6rem; align-items:center; background: rgba(234,179,8,.06); border: 1px solid rgba(234,179,8,.25); color:#fde68a; padding:.4rem .6rem; border-radius:.6rem; margin-bottom:.5rem; cursor:pointer; user-select:none; } .fb-prompt .label { font-size:.6rem; opacity:.8; text-transform:uppercase; } .fb-prompt .text { font-size:.75rem; } /* CAGED overlay toolbar */ .caged-overlay { margin-top:.5rem; display:flex; align-items:center; justify-content:space-between; } .caged-toolbar { display:flex; align-items:center; gap:.5rem; font-size:.8rem; color:#e2e8f0; } .caged-ranges { display:flex; gap:.35rem; flex-wrap:wrap; } .caged-chip { font-size:.65rem; color:#e2e8f0; background: rgba(59,130,246,.15); border:1px solid rgba(59,130,246,.35); border-radius:999px; padding:.15rem .45rem; } /* responsive */ @media (max-width: 900px) { .fb-fret-number { font-size: .55rem; } .fb-string-row, .fb-fret-numbers { grid-template-columns: 42px repeat(25, 42px); } .fb-note { width: 34px; height: 30px; } }

/* Theory sidebar */ .fb-page { display:grid; grid-template-columns: 1fr 320px; gap: 1rem; } .fb-page-main { min-width: 0; } .fb-page-sidebar { min-width: 0; } .sidebar { background: rgba(15,23,42,.25); border: 1px solid rgba(148,163,184,.08); border-radius: .9rem; padding: .8rem; color: #e2e8f0; } .sidebar h3 { margin: 0 0 .25rem 0; } .sidebar .muted { color: #94a3b8; font-size: .8rem; margin: 0 0 .5rem 0; } .sidebar .card { background: rgba(2,6,23,.25); border: 1px solid rgba(148,163,184,.08); border-radius: .7rem; padding: .6rem; margin-bottom: .6rem; } .sidebar .list { list-style: none; margin: 0; padding: 0; display: grid; gap: .35rem; } .sidebar .list li { display: flex; align-items: center; justify-content: space-between; font-size: .85rem; } .sidebar .pill { font-size: .65rem; background: rgba(148,163,184,.15); color:#e2e8f0; border:1px solid rgba(148,163,184,.3); padding:.1rem .4rem; border-radius:999px; }

const cagedData = { major: [ { name: "C shape", start: 0, end: 4 }, { name: "A shape", start: 3, end: 7 }, { name: "G shape", start: 5, end: 9 }, { name: "E shape", start: 7, end: 12 }, { name: "D shape", start: 12, end: 17 }, ], minor: [ { name: "Cm shape", start: 0, end: 4 }, { name: "Am shape", start: 3, end: 7 }, { name: "Gm shape", start: 5, end: 9 }, { name: "Em shape", start: 7, end: 12 }, { name: "Dm shape", start: 12, end: 17 }, ], }; export default cagedData;

const intervalInfo = [ { name: "Unison (R)", semitones: 0 }, { name: "m2", semitones: 1 }, { name: "M2 (2)", semitones: 2 }, { name: "m3", semitones: 3 }, { name: "M3 (3)", semitones: 4 }, { name: "P4 (4)", semitones: 5 }, { name: "TT (b5)", semitones: 6 }, { name: "P5 (5)", semitones: 7 }, { name: "m6", semitones: 8 }, { name: "M6 (6)", semitones: 9 }, { name: "m7", semitones: 10 }, { name: "M7 (7)", semitones: 11 }, { name: "Octave", semitones: 12 }, ]; export default intervalInfo;

import { useMemo } from "react"; import cagedData from "../data/cagedData"; export default function useCagedShapes(root, variant) { return useMemo(() => { const set = cagedData[variant] || []; // naive mapping: shift ranges based on root index for demo return set.map((shape, i) => ({ name: shape.name, fretRange: [shape.start, shape.end], })); }, [root, variant]); }

import { useCallback, useMemo, useState } from "react"; const DEFAULT_PROMPTS = [ "Find all G notes on the fretboard.", "Play the Mixolydian scale starting from the 5th position.", "Ascend then descend A minor pentatonic in position 2.", "Target the 3rd of each chord in a I‚ÄìIV‚ÄìV in C.", ]; export default function usePrompts(seedPrompts) { const prompts = useMemo(() => seedPrompts || DEFAULT_PROMPTS, [seedPrompts]); const [idx, setIdx] = useState(0); const next = useCallback(() => { setIdx((v) => (v + 1) % prompts.length); }, [prompts.length]); return { prompt: prompts[idx], next, }; }
export default function useScalePlayer() { // reserved for future Tone.js schedule integration return null; }

import React, { useEffect, useRef, useState } from "react"; import "../css/metronome.css"; export default function Metronome() { const [bpm, setBpm] = useState(100); const [isOn, setIsOn] = useState(false); const [tick, setTick] = useState(0); const timerRef = useRef(null); const audioRef = useRef(null); useEffect(() => { return () => stop(); // eslint-disable-next-line react-hooks/exhaustive-deps }, []); function click(high = false) { if (!audioRef.current) { audioRef.current = new (window.AudioContext || window.webkitAudioContext)(); } const ctx = audioRef.current; const osc = ctx.createOscillator(); const gain = ctx.createGain(); osc.type = "square"; osc.frequency.value = high ? 1200 : 900; gain.gain.setValueAtTime(0, ctx.currentTime); gain.gain.linearRampToValueAtTime(0.2, ctx.currentTime + 0.005); gain.gain.exponentialRampToValueAtTime(0.0001, ctx.currentTime + 0.08); osc.connect(gain); gain.connect(ctx.destination); osc.start(); osc.stop(ctx.currentTime + 0.09); } function schedule() { const isHigh = tick % 4 === 0; setTick((t) => (t + 1) % 4); click(isHigh); const intervalMs = 60000 / bpm; timerRef.current = setTimeout(schedule, intervalMs); } function start() { if (isOn) return; setIsOn(true); setTick(0); schedule(); } function stop() { setIsOn(false); if (timerRef.current) clearTimeout(timerRef.current); timerRef.current = null; } return (
setBpm(Number(e.target.value))} /> {bpm}
); }

.metro { background: rgba(15,23,42,.25); border:1px solid rgba(148,163,184,.08); border-radius:.8rem; padding:.6rem; color:#e2e8f0; } .metro-row { display:flex; align-items:center; gap:.5rem; margin-bottom:.5rem; } .metro-btn { background: rgba(34,197,94,.15); border:1px solid rgba(34,197,94,.35); color:#bbf7d0; padding:.35rem .6rem; border-radius:.5rem; cursor:pointer; } .metro-led { width:10px; height:10px; border-radius:50%; background: rgba(148,163,184,.25); } .metro-led.on { background: #f59e0b; box-shadow: 0 0 8px rgba(245,158,11,.8); }

import React, { useEffect, useRef, useState } from "react"; const GUITAR_STRINGS = [ { name: "E4", freq: 329.63 }, { name: "B3", freq: 246.94 }, { name: "G3", freq: 196.00 }, { name: "D3", freq: 146.83 }, { name: "A2", freq: 110.00 }, { name: "E2", freq: 82.41 }, ]; export default function TunerWidget() { const [isOn, setIsOn] = useState(false); const [freq, setFreq] = useState(null); const [note, setNote] = useState("--"); const [target, setTarget] = useState({ name: "--", cents: 0 }); const analyserRef = useRef(null); const streamRef = useRef(null); const rafRef = useRef(null); useEffect(() => { if (!isOn) { stopAudio(); return; } startAudio().catch(console.error); return () => { stopAudio(); }; // eslint-disable-next-line react-hooks/exhaustive-deps }, [isOn]); async function startAudio() { const stream = await navigator.mediaDevices.getUserMedia({ audio: true }); const ctx = new (window.AudioContext || window.webkitAudioContext)(); const src = ctx.createMediaStreamSource(stream); const analyser = ctx.createAnalyser(); analyser.fftSize = 2048; src.connect(analyser); analyserRef.current = { analyser, ctx }; streamRef.current = stream; tick(); } function stopAudio() { if (rafRef.current) cancelAnimationFrame(rafRef.current); rafRef.current = null; analyserRef.current = null; if (streamRef.current) { streamRef.current.getTracks().forEach(t => t.stop()); streamRef.current = null; } } function autoCorrelate(buf, sampleRate) { let SIZE = buf.length; let rms = 0; for (let i = 0; i < SIZE; i++) rms += buf[i] * buf[i]; rms = Math.sqrt(rms / SIZE); if (rms < 0.01) return -1; let r1 = 0, r2 = SIZE - 1, th = 0.2; for (let i = 0; i < SIZE / 2; i++) if (Math.abs(buf[i]) < th) { r1 = i; break; } for (let i = 1; i < SIZE / 2; i++) if (Math.abs(buf[SIZE - i]) < th) { r2 = SIZE - i; break; } buf = buf.slice(r1, r2); SIZE = buf.length; const c = new Array(SIZE).fill(0); for (let i = 0; i < SIZE; i++) for (let j = 0; j < SIZE - i; j++) c[i] += buf[j] * buf[j + i]; let d = 0; while (c[d] > c[d + 1]) d++; let maxval = -1, maxpos = -1; for (let i = d; i < SIZE; i++) { if (c[i] > maxval) { maxval = c[i]; maxpos = i; } } const T0 = maxpos; return sampleRate / T0; } function freqToNote(f) { const A4 = 440; const n = Math.round(12 * Math.log2(f / A4)) + 69; const names = ["C","C#","D","D#","E","F","F#","G","G#","A","A#","B"]; const name = names[n % 12]; const oct = Math.floor(n / 12) - 1; return `${name}${oct}`; } function nearestGuitarString(f) { let best = GUITAR_STRINGS[0]; let minErr = Math.abs(f - best.freq); for (let s of GUITAR_STRINGS) { const err = Math.abs(f - s.freq); if (err < minErr) { minErr = err; best = s; } } // cents = 1200 * log2(f/ftarget) const cents = Math.round(1200 * Math.log2(f / best.freq)); return { name: best.name, cents }; } function tick() { rafRef.current = requestAnimationFrame(tick); if (!analyserRef.current) return; const { analyser, ctx } = analyserRef.current; const buf = new Float32Array(analyser.fftSize); analyser.getFloatTimeDomainData(buf); const f = autoCorrelate(buf, ctx.sampleRate); if (f > 0) { setFreq(f.toFixed(1)); setNote(freqToNote(f)); setTarget(nearestGuitarString(f)); } } return (

// jest-dom adds custom jest matchers for asserting on DOM nodes. // allows you to do things like: // expect(element).toHaveTextContent(/react/i) // learn more: https://github.com/testing-library/jest-dom import '@testing-library/jest-dom';
